filmography.title: Lassie Come Home
filmography.role_description: The kind-hearted granddaughter of a wealthy duke who sympathizes with the plight of the collie Lassie and her original owners.
filmography.plot: After her destitute family is forced to sell her, a collie named Lassie escapes from her new owner and begins the long trek from Scotland to her Yorkshire home.

filmography.title: National Velvet
filmography.role_description: A passionate, horse-loving girl who wins a gelding in a lottery and disguises herself as a male jockey to enter him in the Grand National.
filmography.plot: A jaded former jockey helps a young girl prepare a wild but gifted horse for England's Grand National Sweepstakes.

filmography.title: Life with Father
filmography.role_description: A sweet young visitor who charms the eldest son of the blustery Day household, adding to the domestic chaos.
filmography.plot: In 1880s New York City, a bombastic father strives to run his household with the efficiency of his office, but is usually outwitted by his wife and children.

filmography.title: Little Women
filmography.role_description: The youngest of the March sisters, who is artistic, slightly vain, and eventually matures into a sophisticated woman in Europe.
filmography.plot: The four March sisters grow up in New England during the Civil War, dealing with domestic struggles and romantic pursuits.

filmography.title: Father of the Bride
filmography.role_description: The glowing bride-to-be whose upcoming wedding throws her doting father into a financial and emotional tailspin.
filmography.plot: A father comes to grips with his daughter's upcoming wedding and the chaos that surrounds the planning of the event.

filmography.title: A Place in the Sun
filmography.role_description: A breathtakingly beautiful socialite who becomes the object of a poor factory worker's obsession, leading to tragedy.
filmography.plot: A poor boy gets a job working for his rich uncle and ends up falling in love with two women.

filmography.title: Ivanhoe
filmography.role_description: A courageous Jewish healer who is accused of witchcraft and faces death, while secretly loving the knight Ivanhoe.
filmography.plot: A knight returns from the Crusades and seeks to restore the throne to King Richard while defending a Jewish woman falsely accused of witchcraft.

filmography.title: The Last Time I Saw Paris
filmography.role_description: A fun-loving American woman in post-WWII Paris whose marriage to a writer crumbles under the weight of sudden wealth and alcoholism.
filmography.plot: An American writer recalls his turbulent marriage to a wealthy girl in post-WWII Paris.

filmography.title: Rhapsody
filmography.role_description: A wealthy woman who follows a violinist to Zurich, torn between her love for him and a talented pianist.
filmography.plot: A wealthy woman is torn between two loves: a violinist and a pianist, forcing her to choose between talent and devotion.

filmography.title: Giant
filmography.role_description: A strong-willed Maryland socialite who marries a Texas rancher and struggles to adapt to the rugged, patriarchal culture of the West.
filmography.plot: Sprawling epic covering the life of a Texas cattle rancher and his family and their rivalry with cowboy and oil tycoon Jett Rink.

filmography.title: Raintree County
filmography.role_description: A mentally unstable Southern belle who tricks a teacher into marriage, leading to a tumultuous life during the Civil War.
filmography.plot: An idealist teacher marries a beautiful but disturbed Southern belle during the American Civil War.

filmography.title: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
filmography.role_description: A tenacious and seductive wife fighting for her husband's love and her place in his wealthy family amidst lies and alcoholism.
filmography.plot: Brick, an alcoholic ex-football player, drinks his days away and resists the affections of his wife, Maggie. A reunion with his terminal father jogs a host of revelations.

filmography.title: Suddenly, Last Summer
filmography.role_description: A young woman threatened with a lobotomy by her wealthy aunt to prevent her from revealing the shocking truth about her cousin's death.
filmography.plot: The only son of a wealthy widow dies while on vacation with his cousin. The girl's subsequent mental breakdown leads to a demand for a lobotomy to cover up the truth.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress (Drama)

filmography.title: BUtterfield 8
filmography.role_description: A promiscuous model and call girl who falls in love with a married socialite, seeking redemption but facing tragedy.
filmography.plot: A Manhattan call girl engages in a doomed affair with a married man.

filmography.title: Cleopatra
filmography.role_description: The legendary Egyptian queen who seduces Julius Caesar and Mark Antony in a bid to unite the Egyptian and Roman empires.
filmography.plot: The story of the romance between the Egyptian queen Cleopatra and the Roman commander Mark Antony.
filmography.awards: Notable Epic (Highest Paid Actress at the time)

filmography.title: The V.I.P.s
filmography.role_description: A wealthy woman planning to leave her husband for a lover, whose plans are stalled when fog grounds their flight in London.
filmography.plot: A group of passengers are delayed at London Heathrow Airport by fog, and the delay causes various personal dramas to unfold.

filmography.title: The Sandpiper
filmography.role_description: A free-spirited single mother living in Big Sur who begins an illicit affair with the married headmaster of her son's school.
filmography.plot: A free-spirited artist living in Big Sur begins an adulterous affair with the Episcopalian priest who runs the school her son attends.

filmography.title: Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
filmography.role_description: A boozy, bitter, and vitriolic faculty wife who engages in a night of psychological warfare with her husband and a young couple.
filmography.plot: A bitter, aging couple, with the help of alcohol, use a young couple to fuel anguish and emotional pain towards each other during the course of a night.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actress; BAFTA: Win – Best British Actress

filmography.title: The Taming of the Shrew
filmography.role_description: The notoriously ill-tempered and violent daughter of a wealthy merchant who meets her match in the boorish Petruchio.
filmography.plot: Brutish, fortune-hunting Petruchio marries a wealthy, shrewish woman and proceeds to 'tame' her to his will.

filmography.title: Reflections in a Golden Eye
filmography.role_description: The taunting, unfaithful wife of a repressed Army major who engages in an affair with a neighbor on a Southern military base.
filmography.plot: An army major represses his homosexuality while his wife has an affair with a fellow officer on a military base in the South.

filmography.title: The Comedians
filmography.role_description: The wife of a South American ambassador who has an affair with a cynical hotel owner in Duvalier's Haiti.
filmography.plot: A cynical hotel owner finds himself unable to remain neutral in the corrupt and violent political climate of Haiti.

filmography.title: Boom!
filmography.role_description: A terminally ill, incredibly wealthy woman living on a Mediterranean island who dictates her memoirs while engaging with a mysterious poet.
filmography.plot: A dying woman dictates her memoirs to a young poet who may be the Angel of Death.

filmography.title: Secret Ceremony
filmography.role_description: A prostitute grieving her drowned daughter who enters a strange, co-dependent relationship with a mentally unstable young woman.
filmography.plot: A prostitute and a young woman begin a bizarre surrogate mother-daughter relationship that turns dangerous.

filmography.title: X, Y & Zee
filmography.role_description: A loud, vindictive wife who engages in a vicious battle of wits to break up her husband's affair with a younger woman.
filmography.plot: A wife engages in a psychological battle to win back her husband from his mistress.

filmography.title: Ash Wednesday
filmography.role_description: An aging wife who undergoes extensive full-body plastic surgery in a desperate attempt to regain her youth and save her marriage.
filmography.plot: A woman undergoes full-body plastic surgery to save her marriage, but discovers her problems go deeper than her appearance.

filmography.title: The Mirror Crack'd
filmography.role_description: A glamorous movie star making a comeback in an English village who becomes the target of a poisoning attempt.
filmography.plot: Miss Marple investigates when a local woman dies after drinking a poisoned cocktail intended for a visiting movie star.
